data.title: New autoReveal setting for explorer
data.body:
- [x] any OS @isidorn - OS X
- [x] any OS @gregvanl - Windows

There is now a new setting `explorer.autoReveal` to prevent the explorer (not working files) from revealing the currently active file of the editor.
- verify changing this option prevents the explorer from automatically revealing the active file when you switch between files (e.g. from working files)
- verify you have a global action to reveal the active file and it does just that

data.title: .Net Core Debugger installiation issue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open an Asp.Net Core Application

```
Downloading and configuring the .NET Core Debugger...
Running C:\Program Files\dotnet\bin\corerun.exe "C:\Program Files\dotnet\bin\NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll" "restore" "--runtime" "win7-x86" "--runtime" "win7-x64" "--configfile" "NuGet.config"
Process ID: 5880
Specify --help for a list of available options and commands.
error: Unrecognized option '--configfile'
dotnet exited with error code 1
Error while installing .NET Core Debugger.
```

data.title: Debug: consider to drop support to run extension without debugging
data.body:
I find the distinction between "Run" and "Start" very confusing for a user (see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5323).

I suggest for extension development to do the same thing regardless of pressing "Run" or "Start" or indicate that the one is not supported.

What is the use case for running an extension without debugging from VS Code?

@isidorn @weinand fyi

data.title: Verify telemetry
data.body:
@isidorn 
- [x] any os

The telemetry services have been refactored. Verify that
- error telemetry shows extension errors
- error telemetry shows vscode errors
- error telemetry contains no PII
- data telemetry works

data.title: Debug: "Run" vs "Start" is very hard for me to understand
data.body:
I find it very confusing that we have "Start" and "Run" commands in the palette and only one command exposed in the debug viewlet. For a user it is not clear at all which one connects the debugger and which one does not. 

I don't have good ideas how to solve this but some thoughts:
- expose both run and start in the viewlet (let the green arrow be a dropdown?)
- make it very clear (in the label?) that one connects the debugger and one does not
- use a different color in the status bar (not the orange)

@isidorn @weinand @stevencl @bgashler1 fyi

data.title: Text selection in console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.3

BUG 1
Steps to Reproduce:
1. console.log a huge text.
2. Try to select the text in console by using mouse.
3. Notice it will not scroll the console view.

BUG 2
Steps to Reproduce:
1. console.log some text.
2. Try to select the text in console by mouse drag.
3. Try to continue the text selection with keyboard. Holding shift and up arrow.
4. Notice when the selection reaches to the beginning of the console it will continue code selection in the code section from top to bottom.

data.title: Improve sidebar optimal resizing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I implemented sidebar optimal resizing in 65bdaf3. However some desirable characteristics of this feature were postponed due to some implementation challenges—namely, measuring not-yet-rendered DOM elements.  I’m opening this issue to keep track of these sub-features with the hope that they will be solved at some point.

---

(originate from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/4702#issuecomment-205530593)
- [ ] `getOptimalWidth()` doesn’t work if the sidebar is closed, _ie_ you can’t double click on the closed sash to open the sidebar to its optimal width, which is expected;
- [ ] if the explorer list is too long, VSCode renderer will break the list into multiple “tiles” that won’t be displayed concurrently, thus `getOptimalWidth()` will only consider visible elements and not the entire list. For comparison, this is handled correctly by both Atom and SublimeText.

data.title: Auto complete suggests words from comments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 1511

As a student, I write my comments in Romanian, but the functions and variables are mostly in English. So when I try to type something that starts similar in both languages, the suggestions are really confusing and counter-productive.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type a random word in comments 
2. Example in C:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1708491/14555681/9438d03a-02fc-11e6-8aa2-028270810a6e.png)

At least it could be suggested below the function.

data.title: How to build localized UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: master
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'm trying to test a few modifications to Chinese Simplified translation, but can't get the built Code app localized.

I followed the instructions from:
- [Contributing to Code](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/wiki/contributing/how-to-contribute.md)

My build env is:
- Node JS v4.4.3
- Python 2.7.11
- Visual Studio Express 2013

Finally, I started Code successfully with:

```
.\scripts\code.bat
```

However, the localized UI just wouldn't show. I discovered that the nls files,

```
out\vs\workbench\workbench.main.nls.*.js
```

didn't get built.

How should I build them? Thanks!

I tried instruction from #2228, but couldn't clone the monacotools repository because I'm not authorized. And don't know if this is the right way to go.

data.title: Add event information in `onDidSaveTextDocument`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Mac OSX
